page.title: 03LIFE STYLES.
page.content:
Talking to a Local Resident:
We spoke to Mrs. Wilson who lives in one of the houses opposite the Methodist church in Chisworth. She has lived in Chisworth all her life and went to the Methodist Primary School from the time she was five until fourteen, when she went to work in the Holehouse Cotton Mill. She worked there for 25 years, then it closed as a cotton mill and re-opened as a factory where they dyed carpets. In 1967 the mill was taken over by a plastics and rubber firm. Mrs Wilson worked at this mill for all these firms until she retired at 60 years of age. She is now 65 and is the caretaker for the The Methodist Youth Centre.
